Posts.Content: As far as reaching a first year of surviving breast cancer, what date do u start from....the day u found out?....the day of the lumpectomy?...HELP
Posts.Title: Anniversary date

Posts.Content: Hi, I have been diagnosed with stage II breast cancer that spread to 1 lymph node (out of 4).  I am presently taking chemo (YUK) and I'm trying to keep the daily feeling of nausea at bay.  But my question is related to the estrogen part.  I am 50 yrs old and although I have had night sweats for several years, I am told that I am not even peri-menapausal yet!  This freaks me out because I am afraid of the estrogen still in my body.  Am I a candidate for partial hysterectomy?  I do not want to be on Tamoxifen for 5 years...I do not want hormone replacement.....HELP!!!!!
Posts.Title: Stopping the Estrogen

Posts.Content: On 6/13/2008 struggling wrote: I understand what decadron is it's effects excetera because my dad is on it. My question I guess was more why is the dose so high for breast cancer treatment? Was just saying that with the worst for of brain cancer there is my dad has never been on 16mg/day. The highest was 8 mg and that didn't last long. But I guess since it is used for such a short period of time the effects of decadron are not as damaging thankfully!! :) I took this with my second round of chemo and it helped.  I was sooo nauseous with the first round I was apprehensive and was given decadron...2 pills the night before chemo, 2 pills the morning of chemo and 2 pills that same day....good lookin out for your peeps!
Posts.Title: dexamethasone and treatment

Posts.Content: I am 2 weeks post radiation and one part of my breast is charred and the other is peeling down to bloody raw meat (sorry)...i keep a pad on it and use aquaphor and neosporin....anyone else burn from radiation?
Posts.Title: Severe burn after radiation...
